abs.html: Calculates the absolute value of a number. This is a type of sign-related function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
abs.text: Calculates the absolute value of a number. This is a type of sign-related function.

acos.html: Calculates the trigonometric inverse cosine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
acos.text: Calculates the trigonometric inverse cosine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function.

anchor.html: Returns a length relative to the position of the edges of an anchor-positioned element's associated anchor element. This is a type of anchor function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
anchor.text: Returns a length relative to the position of the edges of an anchor-positioned element's associated anchor element. This is a type of anchor function.

anchor-size.html: Returns a length relative to the size of the associated anchor element. This is a type of anchor function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
anchor-size.text: Returns a length relative to the size of the associated anchor element. This is a type of anchor function.

annotation.html: Enables annotations such as circled digits or inverted characters. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value nalt, such as nalt 2. This is a type of font function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
annotation.text: Enables annotations such as circled digits or inverted characters. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value nalt, such as nalt 2. This is a type of font function.

asin.html: Calculates the trigonometric inverse sine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
asin.text: Calculates the trigonometric inverse sine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function.

atan.html: Calculates the trigonometric inverse tangent of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
atan.text: Calculates the trigonometric inverse tangent of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function.

atan2.html: Calculates the trigonometric inverse tangent of two-numbers in a plane. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
atan2.text: Calculates the trigonometric inverse tangent of two-numbers in a plane. This is a type of trigonometric function.

attr.html: The attr() CSS function is used to retrieve the value of an attribute of the selected element and use it in the stylesheet. It can also be used on pseudo-elements, in which case the value of the attribute on the pseudo-element's originating element is returned. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
attr.text: The attr() CSS function is used to retrieve the value of an attribute of the selected element and use it in the stylesheet. It can also be used on pseudo-elements, in which case the value of the attribute on the pseudo-element's originating element is returned.

blur.html: Increases the image gaussian blur. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
blur.text: Increases the image gaussian blur. This is a type of filter function.

brightness.html: Brightens or darkens an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
brightness.text: Brightens or darkens an image. This is a type of filter function.

calc.html: The calc() CSS function lets you perform calculations when specifying CSS property values. It can be used anywhere a "length", "frequency", "angle", "time", "percentage", "number", or "integer" is allowed. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
calc.text: The calc() CSS function lets you perform calculations when specifying CSS property values. It can be used anywhere a <length>, <frequency>, <angle>, <time>, <percentage>, <number>, or <integer> is allowed.

character-variant.html: Enables specific stylistic alternatives for characters. It is similar to styleset(), but doesn't create coherent glyphs for a set of characters; individual characters will have independent and not necessarily coherent styles. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value cvXY, such as cv02. This is a type of font function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
character-variant.text: Enables specific stylistic alternatives for characters. It is similar to styleset(), but doesn't create coherent glyphs for a set of characters; individual characters will have independent and not necessarily coherent styles. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value cvXY, such as cv02. This is a type of font function.

circle.html: Defines a circle shape. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
circle.text: Defines a circle shape. This is a type of shape function.

clamp.html: The clamp() CSS function clamps a value between an upper and lower bound. clamp() enables selecting a middle value within a range of values between a defined minimum and maximum. It takes three parameters: a minimum value, a preferred value, and a maximum allowed value. The clamp() function can be used anywhere a "length", "frequency", "angle", "time", "percentage", "number", or "integer" is allowed. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
clamp.text: The clamp() CSS function clamps a value between an upper and lower bound. clamp() enables selecting a middle value within a range of values between a defined minimum and maximum. It takes three parameters: a minimum value, a preferred value, and a maximum allowed value. The clamp() function can be used anywhere a <length>, <frequency>, <angle>, <time>, <percentage>, <number>, or <integer> is allowed.

color.html: Specifies a particular, specified colorspace rather than the implicit sRGB colorspace. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
color.text: Specifies a particular, specified colorspace rather than the implicit sRGB colorspace. This is a type of color function.

color-contrast.html: Selects the highest color contrast from a list of colors, compare to a base color value. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
color-contrast.text: Selects the highest color contrast from a list of colors, compare to a base color value. This is a type of color function.

color-mix.html: Mixes two color values in a given colorspace by a given amount. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
color-mix.text: Mixes two color values in a given colorspace by a given amount. This is a type of color function.

conic-gradient.html: The conic-gradient() CSS function creates an image consisting of a gradient with color transitions rotated around a center point (rather than radiating from the center). Example conic gradients include pie charts and color wheels. The result of the conic-gradient() function is an object of the <gradient> data type, which is a special kind of <image>. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
conic-gradient.text: The conic-gradient() CSS function creates an image consisting of a gradient with color transitions rotated around a center point (rather than radiating from the center). Example conic gradients include pie charts and color wheels. The result of the conic-gradient() function is an object of the gradient data type, which is a special kind of image.

contrast.html: Increases or decreases the image contrast. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
contrast.text: Increases or decreases the image contrast. This is a type of filter function.

cos.html: Calculates the trigonometric cosine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
cos.text: Calculates the trigonometric cosine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function.

counter.html: Returns a string representing the current value of the named counter if there is one. This is a type of counter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
counter.text: Returns a string representing the current value of the named counter if there is one. This is a type of counter function.

counters.html: Enables nested counters, returning a concatenated string representing the current values of the named counters, if there are any. This is a type of counter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
counters.text: Enables nested counters, returning a concatenated string representing the current values of the named counters, if there are any. This is a type of counter function.

cross-fade.html: Blends two or more images at a defined transparency. This is a type of image function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
cross-fade.text: Blends two or more images at a defined transparency. This is a type of image function.

cubic-bezier.html: Easing function that defines a cubic Bézier curve. This is a type of easing function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
cubic-bezier.text: Easing function that defines a cubic Bézier curve. This is a type of easing function.

device-cmyk.html: Defines CMYK colors in a device-dependent way. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
device-cmyk.text: Defines CMYK colors in a device-dependent way. This is a type of color function.

drop-shadow.html: Applies a drop shadow behind an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
drop-shadow.text: Applies a drop shadow behind an image. This is a type of filter function.

element.html: Defines an <image> value generated from an arbitrary HTML element. This is a type of image function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
element.text: Defines an <image> value generated from an arbitrary HTML element. This is a type of image function.

ellipse.html: Defines an ellipse shape. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
ellipse.text: Defines an ellipse shape. This is a type of shape function.

env.html: Uses the user-agent defined as environment variable. This is a type of reference function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
env.text: Uses the user-agent defined as environment variable. This is a type of reference function.

exp.html: Calculates e raised to the power of a number. This is a type of exponential function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
exp.text: Calculates e raised to the power of a number. This is a type of exponential function.

fit-content.html: Clamps a given size to an available size according to the formula min(maximum size, max(minimum size, argument)). This is a type of grid function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
fit-content.text: Clamps a given size to an available size according to the formula min(maximum size, max(minimum size, argument)). This is a type of grid function.

grayscale.html: Converts an image to grayscale. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
grayscale.text: Converts an image to grayscale. This is a type of filter function.

hsl.html: Defines a given color according to its hue, saturation, lightness and alpha (transparency) components. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
hsl.text: Defines a given color according to its hue, saturation, lightness and alpha (transparency) components. This is a type of color function.

hue-rotate.html: Changes the overall hue of an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
hue-rotate.text: Changes the overall hue of an image. This is a type of filter function.

hwb.html: Defines a given color according to its hue, whiteness and blackness components. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
hwb.text: Defines a given color according to its hue, whiteness and blackness components. This is a type of color function.

hypot.html: Calculates the square root of the sum of the squares of its arguments. This is a type of exponential function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
hypot.text: Calculates the square root of the sum of the squares of its arguments. This is a type of exponential function.

image.html: Defines an <image> in a similar fashion to the <url> type, but with added functionality including specifying the image's directionality and fallback images for when the preferred image is not supported. This is a type of image function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
image.text: Defines an <image> in a similar fashion to the <url> type, but with added functionality including specifying the image's directionality and fallback images for when the preferred image is not supported. This is a type of image function.

image-set.html: Picks the most appropriate CSS image from a given set, primarily for high pixel density screens. This is a type of image function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
image-set.text: Picks the most appropriate CSS image from a given set, primarily for high pixel density screens. This is a type of image function.

inset.html: Defines an inset rectangle shape. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
inset.text: Defines an inset rectangle shape. This is a type of shape function.

invert.html: Inverts the colors of an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
invert.text: Inverts the colors of an image. This is a type of filter function.

lab.html: Defines a given color according to its lightness, a-axis distance and b-axis distance in the lab colorspace. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
lab.text: Defines a given color according to its lightness, a-axis distance and b-axis distance in the lab colorspace. This is a type of color function.

lch.html: Defines a given color according to its lightness, chroma and hue components. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
lch.text: Defines a given color according to its lightness, chroma and hue components. This is a type of color function.

light-dark.html: Returns one of two provided colors based on the current color scheme. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
light-dark.text: Returns one of two provided colors based on the current color scheme. This is a type of color function.

linear.html: Easing function that interpolates linearly between its points. This is a type of easing function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
linear.text: Easing function that interpolates linearly between its points. This is a type of easing function.

linear-gradient.html: The linear-gradient() CSS function creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors along a straight line. Its result is an object of the gradient data type, which is a special kind of image. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
linear-gradient.text: The linear-gradient() CSS function creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors along a straight line. Its result is an object of the gradient data type, which is a special kind of image.

log.html: Calculates the logarithm of a number. This is a type of exponential function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
log.text: Calculates the logarithm of a number. This is a type of exponential function.

matrix.html: Describes a homogeneous 2D transformation matrix. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.

matrix3d.html: Describes a 3D transformation as a 4×4 homogeneous matrix. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
matrix3d.text: Describes a 3D transformation as a 4×4 homogeneous matrix.

max.html: The max() CSS function lets you set the largest (most positive) value from a list of comma-separated expressions as the value of a CSS property value. The max() function can be used anywhere a "length", "frequency", "angle", "time", "percentage", "number", or "integer" is allowed. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
max.text: The max() CSS function lets you set the largest (most positive) value from a list of comma-separated expressions as the value of a CSS property value. The max() function can be used anywhere a <length>, <frequency>, <angle>, <time>, <percentage>, <number>, or <integer> is allowed.

min.html: The min() CSS function lets you set the smallest (most negative) value from a list of comma-separated expressions as the value of a CSS property value. The min() function can be used anywhere a "length", "frequency", "angle", "time", "percentage", "number", or "integer" is allowed. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
min.text: The min() CSS function lets you set the smallest (most negative) value from a list of comma-separated expressions as the value of a CSS property value. The min() function can be used anywhere a <length>, <frequency>, <angle>, <time>, <percentage>, <number>, or <integer> is allowed.

minmax.html: Defines a size range greater-than or equal-to min and less-than or equal-to max. This is a type of grid function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
minmax.text: Defines a size range greater-than or equal-to min and less-than or equal-to max. This is a type of grid function.

mod.html: Calculates a modulus (with the same sign as the divisor) when dividing one number by another. This is a type of stepped function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
mod.text: Calculates a modulus (with the same sign as the divisor) when dividing one number by another. This is a type of stepped function.

oklab.html: Defines a given color according to its lightness, a-axis distance, b-axis distance in the lab colorspace and alpha (transparency). This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
oklab.text: Defines a given color according to its lightness, a-axis distance, b-axis distance in the lab colorspace and alpha (transparency). This is a type of color function.

oklch.html: Defines a given color according to its lightness, chroma, hue and alpha (transparency) components. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
oklch.text: Defines a given color according to its lightness, chroma, hue and alpha (transparency) components. This is a type of color function.

opacity.html: Adds transparency to an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
opacity.text: Adds transparency to an image. This is a type of filter function.

ornaments.html: Enables ornaments such as fleurons and other dingbat glyphs. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value ornm, such as ornm 2. This is a type of font function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
ornaments.text: Enables ornaments such as fleurons and other dingbat glyphs. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value ornm, such as ornm 2. This is a type of font function.

paint.html: Defines an <image> value generated with a PaintWorklet. This is a type of image function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
paint.text: Defines an <image> value generated with a PaintWorklet. This is a type of image function.

path.html: Accepts an SVG path string to enable a shape to be drawn. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
path.text: Accepts an SVG path string to enable a shape to be drawn. This is a type of shape function.

perspective.html: Sets the distance between the user and the z=0 plane. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
perspective.text: Sets the distance between the user and the z=0 plane.

polygon.html: Defines a polygon shape. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
polygon.text: Defines a polygon shape. This is a type of shape function.

pow.html: Calculates the base raised to the power of a number. This is a type of exponential function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
pow.text: Calculates the base raised to the power of a number. This is a type of exponential function.

radial-gradient.html: The radial-gradient() CSS function creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors that radiate from an origin. Its shape may be a circle or an ellipse. The function's result is an object of the <gradient> data type, which is a special kind of <image>. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
radial-gradient.text: The radial-gradient() CSS function creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors that radiate from an origin. Its shape may be a circle or an ellipse. The function's result is an object of the gradient data type, which is a special kind of image

rect.html: Defines a rectangle shape using the distances from the top and left edges of the reference box. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rect.text: Defines a rectangle shape using the distances from the top and left edges of the reference box. This is a type of shape function.

rem.html: Calculates a remainder (with the same sign as the dividend) when dividing one number by another. This is a type of stepped function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rem.text: Calculates a remainder (with the same sign as the dividend) when dividing one number by another. This is a type of stepped function.

repeat.html: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern. This is a type of grid function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
repeat.text: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern. This is a type of grid function.

repeating-conic-gradient.html: Is similar to conic-gradient() and takes the same arguments, but it repeats the color stops infinitely in all directions so as to cover its entire container. This is a type of gradient function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
repeating-conic-gradient.text: Is similar to conic-gradient() and takes the same arguments, but it repeats the color stops infinitely in all directions so as to cover its entire container. This is a type of gradient function.

repeating-linear-gradient.html: Is similar to linear-gradient() and takes the same arguments, but it repeats the color stops infinitely in all directions so as to cover its entire container. This is a type of gradient function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
repeating-linear-gradient.text: Is similar to linear-gradient() and takes the same arguments, but it repeats the color stops infinitely in all directions so as to cover its entire container. This is a type of gradient function.

repeating-radial-gradient.html: Is similar to radial-gradient() and takes the same arguments, but it repeats the color stops infinitely in all directions so as to cover its entire container. This is a type of gradient function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
repeating-radial-gradient.text: Is similar to radial-gradient() and takes the same arguments, but it repeats the color stops infinitely in all directions so as to cover its entire container. This is a type of gradient function.

rgb.html: Defines a given color according to its red, green, blue and alpha (transparency) components. This is a type of color function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rgb.text: Defines a given color according to its red, green, blue and alpha (transparency) components. This is a type of color function.

rotate.html: Rotates an element around a fixed point on the 2D plane. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rotate.text: Rotates an element around a fixed point on the 2D plane.

rotate3d.html: Rotates an element around a fixed axis in 3D space. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rotate3d.text: Rotates an element around a fixed axis in 3D space.

rotateX.html: Rotates an element around the horizontal axis. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rotateX.text: Rotates an element around the horizontal axis.

rotateY.html: Rotates an element around the vertical axis. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rotateY.text: Rotates an element around the vertical axis.

rotateZ.html: Rotates an element around the z-axis. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
rotateZ.text: Rotates an element around the z-axis.

round.html: Calculates a rounded number based on a rounding strategy. This is a type of stepped function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
round.text: Calculates a rounded number based on a rounding strategy. This is a type of stepped function.

saturate.html: Changes the overall saturation of an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
saturate.text: Changes the overall saturation of an image. This is a type of filter function.

scale.html: Scales an element up or down on the 2D plane. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
scale.text: Scales an element up or down on the 2D plane.

scale3d.html: Scales an element up or down in 3D space. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
scale3d.text: Scales an element up or down in 3D space.

scaleX.html: Scales an element up or down horizontally. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
scaleX.text: Scales an element up or down horizontally.

scaleY.html: Scales an element up or down vertically. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
scaleY.text: Scales an element up or down vertically.

scaleZ.html: Scales an element up or down along the z-axis. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
scaleZ.text: Scales an element up or down along the z-axis.

scroll.html: Sets the animation-timeline of an element to an anonymous scroll progress timeline. This is a type of animation function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
scroll.text: Sets the animation-timeline of an element to an anonymous scroll progress timeline. This is a type of animation function.

sepia.html: Increases the sepia of an image. This is a type of filter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
sepia.text: Increases the sepia of an image. This is a type of filter function.

shape.html: Accepts a comma-separated list of commands defining the shape to be drawn. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
shape.text: Accepts a comma-separated list of commands defining the shape to be drawn. This is a type of shape function.

sign.html: Calculates the sign (positive or negative) of the number. This is a type of sign-related function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
sign.text: Calculates the sign (positive or negative) of the number. This is a type of sign-related function.

sin.html: Calculates the trigonometric sine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
sin.text: Calculates the trigonometric sine of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function.

skew.html: Skews an element on the 2D plane. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
skew.text: Skews an element on the 2D plane.

skewX.html: Skews an element in the horizontal direction. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
skewX.text: Skews an element in the horizontal direction.

skewY.html: Skews an element in the vertical direction. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
skewY.text: Skews an element in the vertical direction.

sqrt.html: Calculates the square root of a number. This is a type of exponential function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
sqrt.text: Calculates the square root of a number. This is a type of exponential function.

steps.html: Iteration along a specified number of stops along the transition, displaying each stop for equal lengths of time. This is a type of easing function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
steps.text: Iteration along a specified number of stops along the transition, displaying each stop for equal lengths of time. This is a type of easing function.

styleset.html: Enables stylistic alternatives for sets of characters. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value ssXY, such as ss02. This is a type of font function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
styleset.text: Enables stylistic alternatives for sets of characters. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value ssXY, such as ss02. This is a type of font function.

stylistic.html: Enables stylistic alternates for individual characters. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value salt, like salt 2. This is a type of font function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
stylistic.text: Enables stylistic alternates for individual characters. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType value salt, like salt 2. This is a type of font function.

swash.html: Enables swash glyphs. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType values swsh and cswh, such as swsh 2 and cswh 2. This is a type of font function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
swash.text: Enables swash glyphs. The parameter is a font-specific name mapped to a number. It corresponds to the OpenType values swsh and cswh, such as swsh 2 and cswh 2. This is a type of font function.

symbols.html: Defines the counter styles inline, directly as the value of a property. This is a type of counter function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
symbols.text: Defines the counter styles inline, directly as the value of a property. This is a type of counter function.

tan.html: Calculates the trigonometric tangent of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
tan.text: Calculates the trigonometric tangent of a number. This is a type of trigonometric function.

translate.html: Translates an element on the 2D plane. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
translate.text: Translates an element on the 2D plane.

translate3d.html: Translates an element in 3D space. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.

translateX.html: Translates an element horizontally. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.

translateY.html: Translates an element vertically. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.

translateZ.html: Translates an element along the z-axis. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
translateZ.text: Translates an element along the z-axis.

url.html: The url() function is used to include external resources, like images or fonts, in your CSS. You just need to provide the link to the resource by providing a link to that asset. This is a type of reference function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
url.text: The url() function is used to include external resources, like images or fonts, in your CSS by providing a link to that asset.

var.html: The var() CSS function can be used to insert the value of a custom property (sometimes called a "CSS variable") instead of any part of a value of another property. Learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
var.text: The var() CSS function can be used to insert the value of a custom property (sometimes called a "CSS variable") instead of any part of a value of another property.

view.html: Sets the animation-timeline of an element to an anonymous view progress timeline. This is a type of animation function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
view.text: Sets the animation-timeline of an element to an anonymous view progress timeline. This is a type of animation function.

xywh.html: Defines a rectangle shape using the specified distances from the top and left edges of the reference box and the rectangle width and height. This is a type of shape function, learn more in this CSS Functions Guide.
xywh.text: Defines a rectangle shape using the specified distances from the top and left edges of the reference box and the rectangle width and height. This is a type of shape function.
